name: Diokophobia (USW Games, ImmortalFox, chelseasel, AaronTEady, Lithuenza_Azrangr, Jonas Autenrieth, Shannon_N)
name_original: Diokophobia (USW Games, ImmortalFox, chelseasel, AaronTEady, Lithuenza_Azrangr, Jonas Autenrieth, Shannon_N)
description:
You are a student who wakes up and finds themselves in the University after hours. You try to leave but all the doors leading to the outside world are locked and there is no way out. You notice that your key card has gone missing and you hope that it's in one of the rooms. You place your hopes in the fact that the key card will lead you to freedom, so you begin your search as you walk through the dimly lit hallways.  Be careful as you search however, as someone or something is watching you. Stalking you. If it catches you, who knows what will happen. Good luck.

This project was created as part of a second year university brief at the University of South Wales, in association with Tiny Rebel Games. The module brief was "These are our fears". Teams had to make games that were 8 to 10 minutes long, taking place in small environment that students frequently use, the theme of the game was student fears.

Development Team    
Game Designers:  
Ieuan Williams - Lead Game Designer & Mechanics Developer
Andreas Stylianou - UI/UX Designer & Mechanics Developer
Chelsea Selmo - Level Designer & Mechanics Developer
Aaron Eady - AI Designer

Game Artists:  
Shannon Nicholls - Lead Game Artist & Environmental Artist
Alec Parker - Character Artist
Jonas Autenrieth - Concept Artist & Environmental Artist
Christopher Daniel - Environmental Artist

With special thanks to Susan Cummings & Lee Cummings at Tiny Rebel Games. 

Find out more about the University of South Wales Games' courses at http://southwales.ac.uk/games and http://www.twitter.com/uswgames
